main_definition: To completely remove or get rid of something, usually an obstacle, problem, or unwanted element.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To remove a challenge or threat from the way.
meanings_and_examples.example: The new safety measures help eliminate hazards in the workplace.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To exclude something from consideration, especially from a list of options or choices.
meanings_and_examples.example: After reviewing all candidates, we will eliminate some names from our shortlist for the position.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To eradicate an undesirable element, such as disease or pests in agriculture.
meanings_and_examples.example: The farmer had to eliminate aphids from his crops using natural insecticides.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To remove evidence of something that has occurred, typically to avoid detection or consequences.
meanings_and_examples.example: The spy tried to eliminate all traces of his presence at the target location.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In a game or competition context, to leave an opponent out by winning against them and reducing their chances in the event.
meanings_and_examples.example: Our team's victory eliminated the rival team from contention for the championship title.
